For many service providers, tips can significantly supplement their income and help them maintain a decent standard of living. Consequently, those service providers may not see tips as insulting but as a way of acknowledging their efforts and dedication to their jobs.

Secondly, customers who tip often view the practice as a means to reward good service or to offer support to the service provider. While the tipping system may have its flaws, the intention of tipping is generally positive and aims to encourage excellent service.

That said, some alternative solutions could be considered, such as implementing a living wage for service employees or raising prices to include gratuity, so tipping is not the primary source of supplementary income. However, as long as the tipping culture persists, it is essential to understand and respect its purpose rather than dismiss it outright as insulting to both customers and servers.
